author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
1. At Bhaṇḍa Village
6. A Little Learning
“Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
What four? A person may have:

segments.pli: Appassuto sutena anupapanno, appassuto sutena upapanno, bahussuto sutena anupapanno, bahussuto sutena upapanno.
segments.en:
1. Little learning and not get the point of learning.
  2. Little learning but get the point of learning.
  3. Much learning but not get the point of learning.
  4. Much learning and get the point of learning.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo appassuto hoti sutena anupapanno?
segments.en: And how has a person learned little and not got the point of learning?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appakaṃ sutaṃ hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a person has learned little of the

segments.pli: suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: So tassa appakassa sutassa na atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: And with the little they’ve learned, they understand neither the meaning nor the text, nor do they practice in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo appassuto hoti sutena anupapanno.
segments.en: That’s how a person has learned little and not got the point of learning.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo appassuto hoti sutena upapanno?
segments.en: And how has a person learned little but has got the point of learning?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appakaṃ sutaṃ hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a person has learned little of the

segments.pli: suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: So tassa appakassa sutassa atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: But with the little they’ve learned, they understand the meaning and the text, and they practice in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo appassuto hoti sutena upapanno.
segments.en: That’s how a person has learned little but has got the point of learning.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena anupapanno?
segments.en: And how has a person learned much but hasn't got the point of learning?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa bahukaṃ sutaṃ hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a person has learned much of the

segments.pli: suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: So tassa bahukassa sutassa na atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: But even though they’ve learned much, they understand neither the meaning nor the text, nor do they practice in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena anupapanno.
segments.en: That’s how a person has learned much but hasn't got the point of learning.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena upapanno?
segments.en: And how has a person learned much and has got the point of learning?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa bahukaṃ sutaṃ hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a person has learned much of the

segments.pli: suttaṃ geyyaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ gāthā udānaṃ itivuttakaṃ jātakaṃ abbhutadhammaṃ vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: So tassa bahukassa sutassa atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: And with the large amount they’ve learned, they understand the meaning and the text, and they practice in line with the teaching.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo bahussuto hoti sutena upapanno.
segments.en: That’s how a person has learned much and has got the point of learning.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasminti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.
If you don’t learn much,
and aren’t steady in ethics,
they’ll criticize you on both counts,
for your ethics and your learning.
If you don’t learn much,
and you are steady in ethics,
they’ll praise your ethical conduct,
since your learning has succeeded.
If you learn much,
but aren’t steady in ethics,
they’ll criticize your ethical conduct,
for your learning hasn’t succeeded.
If you learn much,
and you are steady in ethics,
they’ll praise you on both counts,
for your ethics and your learning.
A wise disciple of the Buddha
who has much learning, and has memorized the teachings,
is like a coin of mountain gold.
Who is worthy of criticizing them?
Even the gods praise them,
and by Brahmā, too, they’re praised.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.…

suttaplex.blurb: Learning the texts and getting the point of learning.
